header.p: Tyrex is the missing piece in the J2EE puzzle, a J2EE service provider for both Servlet and EJB container, JMS providers and generic connectors. It provides services for security and authentication, local and distributed transactions, resource configuration and pooling, and TP monitoring. Tyrex is presently integrated with Tomcat and OpenEJB.
Note: Presently we are only hosting one mailing list. Traffic is not high, so if you are interested in keeping up to date with new releases, please subscribe to this list.

section.title: Features
section.p:
Short feature list (we haven't got all day):
Full support for JTA and OTS transactions APIs
Support for local and distributed transactions
JAAS-based authentication, LDAP login module
Configurable transaction processing monitor
JDBC pooling and automatic JDBC resource enlistment
Connector architecture
XML/JNDI based configuration
JNDI environment naming context
Transaction context propagation over IIOP and RMI
Tomcat 3.1 connector

section.title: About Tyrex
section.p: Tyrex is the missing piece in the J2EE puzzle, the hidden back end behind the Servlet, EJB and JMS servers. Tyrex was originally developed as a separate back-end that can be used with Tomcat, OpenEJB, OpenJMS and a variety of other servers. Due to its nature as a back-end system, Tyrex is probably one of the most boring open source projects on earth.
Most of the code released in Tyrex has been developed by Assaf Arkin, CTO <arkin@exoffice.com>. Contributors are welcome to join this project. Please join us on the mailing list.
